| History                 = Brevoort Dynamics was a robotics company located in [[Cambridge (Massachusetts)|Cambridge]], [[Massachusetts (State)|Massachusetts]]. While testing out the stability of a quadruped robot by repeatedly knocking it over, two employees were interrupted by [[Awesome Android (Earth-616)|Awesome Andy]], who abducted the robot on behalf of the [[A.I. Army (Earth-616)|A.I. Army]].{{r|Iron Man 2020 Vol 2 2}}
| Equipment               =

| Notes                   = 
| Trivia                  = * Brevoort Dynamics is named after editor [[Tom Brevoort|Tom Brevoort]]. The company's logo consists of a fedora and a pair of glasses, which are Brevoort's trademark accessories.
* Brevoort Dynamics also appears to double as a reference to the real-life company {{WP|Boston Dynamics}}, which is best known for the development of quadruped canine-inspired robots. Boston Dynamics' robots became popular in 2015 following a viral video in which a robot's stability was tested by being repeatedly kicked over. Like Brevoort Dynamics, Boston Dynamics is located in [[Massachusetts (State)|Massachusetts]].{{r|{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/innovations/wp/2015/02/12/googles-robotic-dog-that-cant-stop-getting-kicked-laps-up-internet-sympathy/|title=Google’s robotic ‘dog’ — that can’t stop getting kicked — laps up Internet sympathy|work=The Washington Post|first=Matt|last=McFarland|date=12 February 2015|accessdate=15 February 2020}}}}
